info.title: OneDrive
info.description: Keep your userâ€™s files, folders, and photos in OneDrive to make them accessible on any device and at any time

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: You can use the select query string parameter to provide a comma-separated list of properties to return on Items.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: You can use the expand query string parameter to instruct the API to expand a children collection and include those results.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: You can use the orderby query string to control the sort order of the items returned from the API. For a collection of items, the following fields are allowed to be used in the orderby parameter:

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Specify the number of items to return in a result set. The API may have a hard limit that prevents you from asking for more items per response.

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: Paging token that can be used to get the next set of results

get.description: Get metadata about user's default drive.

parameters.name: drive-id
parameters.description: The ID for the drive requested

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: You can use the select query string parameter to provide a comma-separated list of properties to return on Items.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: You can use the expand query string parameter to instruct the API to expand a children collection and include those results.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: You can use the orderby query string to control the sort order of the items returned from the API. For a collection of items, the following fields are allowed to be used in the orderby parameter:

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Specify the number of items to return in a result set. The API may have a hard limit that prevents you from asking for more items per response.

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: Paging token that can be used to get the next set of results

get.description: Get metadata of a drive by unique identifier.

parameters.name: special-folder-name
parameters.description: The special folder name

get.description:
Special folders provide simple aliases to access well known folders in OneDrive
without the need to look up the folder by path (which would require localization)
or referencing the folder with an ID. If a special folder is renamed or moved
to another location within the Drive, this syntax will continue to find that
folder.

parameters.name: special-folder-name
parameters.description: The special folder name

get.description:
Special folders provide simple aliases to access well known folders in OneDrive
without the need to look up the folder by path (which would require localization)
or referencing the folder with an ID. If a special folder is renamed or moved
to another location within the Drive, this syntax will continue to find that
folder.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description: If this request header is included and the etag provided does not match the current etag on the item, a 412 Precondition Failed error response is returned.

parameters.name: parent-path
parameters.description: The parent folder's path.   Ex: root, special/public, etc.

parameters.name: file-name
parameters.description: The file name

post.description:
To support the upload of larger files, a resumable upload method is necessary
to ensure that the whole file can be uploaded in pieces and easily resumed if
the transfer is interrupted.

parameters.name: upload-fragment
parameters.description: the upload URL part after 'https://api.onedrive.com/up/' returned from creating a session for uploading a large file in fragments

parameters.name: Content-Range
parameters.description: Specify the range of the bytes to be uploaded and the total size.

put.description: Once your app has created an upload session, you can upload the fragments.

parameters.name: upload-fragment
parameters.description: the upload URL part after 'https://api.onedrive.com/up/' returned from creating a session for uploading a large file in fragments

get.description: Once your app has created an upload session, you can find out what fragments are left to be uploaded.

parameters.name: upload-fragment
parameters.description: the upload URL part after 'https://api.onedrive.com/up/' returned from creating a session for uploading a large file in fragments

delete.description: Once your app has created an upload session, you can abort the upload.

parameters.name: parent-path
parameters.description: the 'parent-path' of the item to be created.  Ex: root, special/public

parameters.name: nameConflict
parameters.description: Determines what to do if a file with a matching filename already exists in this folder. Accepted values are: rename, replace, and fail (the default).

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Since the body of the request is in JSON, the request header should be set accordingly.

post.description: Add a new item under an existing parent item.

parameters.name: parent-path
parameters.description: The parent folder.   Ex: root, special/public, etc.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: The file name (myFilename.txt) or the file name with path relative to the parent folder (path/to/my/folder/myFileName.txt) of the item to be uploaded

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Always use the Content-Type value application/octet-stream when uploading binary content to the OneDrive API. This will ensure that the contents of the file are not misinterpreted.

put.description:
The simple upload API allows you to provide the contents of a new file or update
the contents of an existing file in a single API call. This method only supports
files up to 100MB in size.

parameters.name: parent-item
parameters.description: The parent item.   Ex: root, special/public, root:/path/to/my/folder: etc.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: respond-async to enable asynchronous item transfer. Otherwise the request is aborted.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Since the body of the request is in JSON, the request header should be set accordingly.

post.description:
Upload from URL allows your app to upload a file to OneDrive from a remote
server without streaming the bytes through your client. This is especially useful
for mobile clients or browser add-ins where it may be optimal to not transfer
the bytes of the file through the local client.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: the URL part after 'https://api.onedrive.com/v1.0/monitor/' returned in the 'Location' header after copying an item

get.description: Returns details about how to monitor the progress of the copy, upon accepting the request.

parameters.name: item-path
parameters.description: the 'item-path' of the item to be copied.  Ex: root:/myFile.zip

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: respond-async to enable asynchronous item transfer. Otherwise the request is aborted.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Since the body of the request is in JSON, the request header should be set accordingly.

post.description: Create copy of an Item (including any children) under a new parent.

parameters.name: item-id
parameters.description: the 'item-id' of the item to be copied

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: respond-async to enable asynchronous item transfer. Otherwise the request is aborted.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Since the body of the request is in JSON, the request header should be set accordingly.

post.description: Create copy of an Item (including any children) under a new parent.

parameters.name: parent-id
parameters.description: the 'parent-id' of the item to be created

parameters.name: nameConflict
parameters.description: Determines what to do if a file with a matching filename already exists in this folder. Accepted values are: rename, replace, and fail (the default).

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Since the body of the request is in JSON, the request header should be set accordingly.

post.description: Add a new item under an existing parent item.

parameters.name: item-path
parameters.description: the 'item-path' of the item to be deleted.  Ex: root:/myFile.zip, special/public:/path/to/my/folder, special/public:/myFile.zip, etc.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description: If this request header is included and the etag provided does not match the current etag on the item, an 412 Precondition Failed response is returned and the item will not be deleted.

delete.description: Add a new item under an existing parent item.

parameters.name: item-path
parameters.description: the 'item-path' of the item to view the metadata for.  Ex: root, root:/myFile.zip, special/public, special/public:/myFile.zip, etc.

parameters.name: if-none-match
parameters.description: If this request header is included and the etag provided matches the current etag on the file, an HTTP 304 Not Modified response is returned.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: If set to "children", includes the children of an item in the same call as retrieving the metadata of an item

get.description: Retrieve the metadata for an Item by path or ID.

parameters.name: item-path
parameters.description: the 'item-path' of the item to be moved.  Ex: root:/myFile.jpg, special/public, special/public:/myFile.jpg, etc.

parameters.name: X-HTTP-Method-Override
parameters.description: Apigee's API console doesn't support PATCH but the OneDrive API supports HTTP Method overriding.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description: If this request header is included and the etag provided does not match the current etag on the folder, an 412 Precondition Failed response is returned.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Since the body of the request is in JSON, the request header should be set accordingly.

post.description: Change the parent folder for an Item resource.

parameters.description: the 'item-id' of the item to be deleted

parameters.description: If this request header is included and the etag provided does not match the current etag on the item, an 412 Precondition Failed response is returned and the item will not be deleted.

parameters.name: expand

parameters.name: item-path
parameters.description: the 'item-path' of the item to be downloaded.  Ex: root:/myFile.zip, special/public:/myFile.zip, etc.

parameters.name: range

get.description: Use this API to download the contents (default stream) for an Item with the File facet.

parameters.name: item-id
parameters.description: the 'item-id' of the item to be downloaded

parameters.name: if-none-match
parameters.description: If this request header is included and the etag provided matches the current etag on the file, an HTTP 304 Not Modified response is returned.

parameters.name: range
parameters.description: Range of bytes that should be returned in the request.

get.description: Use this API to download the contents (default stream) for an Item with the File facet.

parameters.name: item-path
parameters.description: the 'item-path' of the item to get the thumbnails for.  Ex: root:/myFile.jpg, special/public:/myFile.jpg, etc.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: You can use the select query string parameter to control which thumbnail sizes are returned in the ThumbnailSet. For example: /thumbnails?select=medium to retrieve only the medium sized thumbnails.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: In addition to the defined sizes, your app can request a custom thumbnail size by specifying the dimensions of the thumbnail prefixed with 'c' For example if you need thumbnails that are 300x400, you can request that size like 'c300x400'

get.description: Retrieve available thumbnails for an Item by path or ID.

parameters.name: item-id
parameters.description: the 'item-id' of the item to get the thumbnails for

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: You can use the select query string parameter to control which thumbnail sizes are returned in the ThumbnailSet. For example: /thumbnails?select=medium to retrieve only the medium sized thumbnails.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: In addition to the defined sizes, your app can request a custom thumbnail size by specifying the dimensions of the thumbnail prefixed with 'c' For example if you need thumbnails that are 300x400, you can request that size like 'c300x400'

get.description: Retrieve available thumbnails for an Item by path or ID.

parameters.name: item-path
parameters.description: the 'item-path' of the item to get the thumbnail for.  Ex: root:/myFile.jpg, special/public:/myFile.jpg, etc.

parameters.name: thumbnail-set-index
parameters.description: The index of the thumbnail, usually 0-4.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the thumbnail requested

parameters.name: item-path
parameters.description: the 'item-path' of the item to view the changes for. Ex: root:/myFile.jpg:, special/public:/myFile.jpg, etc.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The last token returned from the previous call to view.delta. If omitted, view.delta will return the current state of the hierarchy.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Since the body of the request is in JSON, the request header should be set accordingly.

get.description: Enumerate the changes under a folder since a given state, represented by a change token. This enables your application to maintain a local representation of the contents of a drive and update the local state efficiently.

parameters.name: item-id
parameters.description: the 'item-id' of the item to view the changes for

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The last token returned from the previous call to view.delta. If omitted, view.delta will return the current state of the hierarchy.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Since the body of the request is in JSON, the request header should be set accordingly.

get.description: Enumerate the changes under a folder since a given state, represented by a change token. This enables your application to maintain a local representation of the contents of a drive and update the local state efficiently.

parameters.name: item-path
parameters.description: the 'item-path' of the item to search under.  Ex: root:/path/to/my/folder

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The query text used to search the item's index.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: You can use the select query string parameter to provide a comma-separated list of properties to return on Items.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: You can use the expand query string parameter to instruct the API to expand a children collection and include those results.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: You can use the orderby query string to control the sort order of the items returned from the API. For a collection of items, the following fields are allowed to be used in the orderby parameter:

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Specify the number of items to return in a result set. The API may have a hard limit that prevents you from asking for more items per response.

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: Paging token that can be used to get the next set of results

get.description: Search the hierarchy of items for items matching a query. Filenames and content of items may be searched depending on the query.

parameters.name: item-id
parameters.description: the 'item-id' of the item to search under

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The query text used to search the item's index.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: You can use the select query string parameter to provide a comma-separated list of properties to return on Items.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: You can use the exapnd query string parameter to instruct the API to expand a children collection and include those results.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: You can use the orderby query string to control the sort order of the items returned from the API. For a collection of items, the following fields are allowed to be used in the orderby parameter:

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Specify the number of items to return in a result set. The API may have a hard limit that prevents you from asking for more items per response.

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: Paging token that can be used to get the next set of results

get.description: Search the hierarchy of items for items matching a query. Filenames and content of items may be searched depending on the query.

parameters.name: item-path
parameters.description: the 'item-path' of the item to list the children of.  Ex: root:/path/to/my/folder, special/public:/path/to/my/folder

parameters.name: if-none-match
parameters.description: If this request header is included and the etag provided matches the current etag on the file, an HTTP 304 Not Modified response is returned.

get.description: Items with the Folder facet may contain one or more child items. This API lists the contents of the item's Children collection using either the Item ID or path to the Item.

parameters.name: item-id
parameters.description: the 'item-id' of the item to list the children of

parameters.name: if-none-match
parameters.description: If this request header is included and the etag provided matches the current etag on the file, an HTTP 304 Not Modified response is returned.

get.description: Items with the Folder facet may contain one or more child items. This API lists the contents of the item's Children collection using either the Item ID or path to the Item.

parameters.name: item-path
parameters.description: the 'item-path' of the item to create a sharing link for. Ex: root:/path/to/my/folder, root:/path/to/my/folder:/myFile.zip, special/public:/myFile.zip, etc.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Since the body of the request is in JSON, the request header should be set accordingly.

post.description: The createLink action can be used to share an existing Item via a link.

parameters.name: item-id
parameters.description: the 'item-id' of the item to create a sharing link for

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Since the body of the request is in JSON, the request header should be set accordingly.

post.description: The createLink action can be used to share an existing Item via a link.
